general_requirements.statewide_program_name: No statewide framework. Requirements vary by AHJ. Most cities require building and electrical permits. PE stamps typically required for systems over 10 kW. New consumer protection laws SB 1036/SB 1697 effective September 2025.

interconnection.net_metering_details: No statewide net metering. Some retail electric providers offer buyback programs. CenterPoint Energy handles interconnection for Houston area. Oncor for DFW area.
interconnection.fees: CenterPoint: application fee varies; Oncor: varies by system size

special_considerations.hoa_restrictions: Texas Property Code 202.010 protects solar. HOAs cannot prohibit solar but can set aesthetic guidelines.
special_considerations.historic_districts: Local historic district rules apply. El Paso historic districts require plan review.
special_considerations.wind_load_requirements: Coastal areas have hurricane wind requirements. Design wind speeds vary 90-150 mph.
special_considerations.snow_load_requirements: Generally minimal. Panhandle/West Texas may have 10-15 psf.

licensing.license_type: Master Electrician license required. San Antonio requires city-registered master electrician. TDLR registration for solar retailers effective September 2025.

notes: Largest deregulated electricity market. Houston implemented SolarAPP+ July 2024. Dallas requires two separate online portals. Austin has streamlined green energy permits. San Antonio requires CPS Energy approval. PE stamp >10 kW in most metros. New consumer protection laws (SB 1036/SB 1697) require retailer registration.

jurisdictions.name: Houston
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: 2015 IFC Section 1204.5.1 rapid shutdown. Minimum 4-ft roof access pathways for firefighters.
jurisdictions.notes: SolarAPP+ implemented July 2024 for streamlined processing. PE stamp required for systems >10 kW. CenterPoint Energy handles interconnection.

jurisdictions.name: San Antonio
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: IFC rapid shutdown requirements. Roof access pathways.
special_requirements: CPS Energy approval required for all installations
jurisdictions.notes: CPS Energy approval required. State-licensed master electrician registered with city of SA required for electrical permit. No ITC available (no net metering market).

jurisdictions.name: Dallas
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: IFC rapid shutdown. Firefighter access pathways required.
jurisdictions.notes: Requires use of two different online portals that are not automatically connected. Multiple city staffers review sequentially, not simultaneously. Can slow the process.

jurisdictions.name: Austin
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: IFC rapid shutdown. Standard firefighter access pathways.
special_requirements: Austin Energy Distributed Generation Planning Application required
Austin Energy review may be needed before electrical permit
jurisdictions.notes: Streamlined green energy permits with fast-track processing. Austin Energy DG Planning Application required before electrical permit for certain system criteria.

jurisdictions.name: Fort Worth
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: IFC rapid shutdown. Standard access pathways.
jurisdictions.notes: Streamlined permitting process asks series of questions to determine needed application. Online submission of all required documents.

jurisdictions.name: El Paso
special_requirements: Historic districts require additional plan review
jurisdictions.notes: Older developments and historic districts may require city plan review before permit issuance. Newer areas have straightforward process.

jurisdictions.name: Arlington
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: IFC rapid shutdown. Standard access pathways.
jurisdictions.notes: Standard Texas permitting process. Oncor handles interconnection for the DFW area.
